author: vexx32
body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->

# PR Summary

- Refactor for newer & tidier code patterns
- Avoid super long lines where possible
- Consolidate style and patterns

Shouldn't be any functional changes. 

## PR Context

More code cleanup! ^^

## PR Checklist

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` or `[ WIP ]` to the beginning of the title (the `WIP` bot will keep its status check at `Pending` while the prefix is present) and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **[Breaking changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)**
    - [x] None
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Experimental feature(s) needed](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/PowerShell-Docs/blob/staging/reference/6/Microsoft.PowerShell.Core/About/about_Experimental_Features.md)
        - [ ] Experimental feature name(s): <!-- Experimental feature name(s) here -->
- **User-facing changes**
    - [x] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed: <!-- Number/link of that issue here -->
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [x] N/A or can only be tested interactively
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: @iSazonov did you guys need anything more from me here, or is this good to be merged? 🙂

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
@vexx32 Codacy is saying you are introducing more issues than you are fixing.

Can you please review those issues?

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 yeah I've seen them. Codacy sees the inline variable declaration pattern `if (myVar is Type newVar)` and thinks I'm putting in an if statement that lacks braces. Something in its logic is simply incorrect, not sure exactly what's up, but it's not handling these right:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32407840/59633400-64ede400-911a-11e9-9f68-0f63f68c29a8.png)

I think those are a majority of its complaints here.

It's also making recommendations about removing methods / changing method access modifiers, which I think is probably better determined by you guys if we need to action on any of those recommendations than me tinkering around. 😄 

There are a few unused methods/props here too, unsure if you want anything done with those.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Codacy doesn't know new C# features and reports many false positives.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: We can maybe disable everything except PowerShell on Codacy.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Codacy  does useful recommendations too which we follow and which is not in CodeFactor. 
It makes some recommendations unacceptable to us but I find the tool useful as whole. Perhaps we need configure it more carefully.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
We could have two configs for CodeFactor and Codacy.
First minimal set with mandatory rules for mandatory CI (to block PR merging)
Second config for optional CI with extended set rules (like complex methods, XML docs...)

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Sounds good to me. I agree that it does make some more insightful suggestions at times. But there are also times where it just... makes no sense. Higher rate of false positives, I guess you could say. 🙂

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 @anmenaga any chance we could get this one merged soon-ish as well? 💖 

Once this is in, #9900 is ready to go. 😁

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body: @vexx32 Please fix the merge conflict with CompiledScriptBlock.cs and I'll merge this. Thank you.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: @anmenaga That ought to do it, I think. Let me know if there's anything more y'all need. 🙂

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
:tada:`v7.0.0-preview.2` has been released which incorporates this pull request.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.0.0-preview.2)

title: Cleanup CompiledScriptBlock.cs
